feed_description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

items.title: Some on-air claims about Dominion Voting Systems were false, Fox News acknowledges in statement after deal is announced
Dominion still has pending lawsuits against election deniers such as Rudy Giuliani and Sidney Powell
Here are the 20 specific Fox broadcasts and tweets Dominion says were defamatory
items.content:
• Fox-Dominion trial delay 'is not unusual,' judge says

items.title: Judge in Fox News-Dominion defamation trial: 'The parties have resolved their case'
items.content: The judge just announced in court that a settlement has been reached in the historic defamation case between Fox News and Dominion Voting Systems.

items.title: 'Difficult to say with a straight face': Tapper reacts to Fox News' statement on settlement
items.content: A settlement has been reached in Dominion Voting Systems' defamation case against Fox News, the judge for the case announced. The network will pay more than $787 million to Dominion, a lawyer for the company said.

items.title: Millions in the US could face massive consequences unless McCarthy can navigate out of a debt trap he set for Biden
items.content:
• DeSantis goes to Washington, a place he once despised, looking for support to take on Trump
• Opinion: For the GOP to win, it must ditch Trump
• Chris Christie mulling 2024 White House bid
• Analysis: The fire next time has begun burning in Tennessee

items.title: White homeowner accused of shooting a Black teen who rang his doorbell turns himself in to face criminal charges
items.content:
• 'A major part of Ralph died': Aunt of teen shot after ringing wrong doorbell speaks
• 20-year-old woman shot after friend turned into the wrong driveway in upstate New York, officials say

items.title: Newly released video shows scene of Jeremy Renner's snowplow accident
items.content: Newly released body camera footage shows firefighters and sheriff's deputies rushing to help actor Jeremy Renner after a near-fatal snowplow accident in January. The "Avengers" actor broke more than 30 bones and suffered other severe injuries. CNN's Chloe Melas has more.

items.title: Jake Gyllenhaal and Jamie Lee Curtis spent the Covid-19 lockdown together
items.content: It's sourdough bread and handstands for Jake Gyllenhaal and Jamie Lee Curtis.

items.title: Toddler crawls through White House fence, prompts Secret Service response
items.content: A tiny intruder infiltrated White House grounds Tuesday, prompting a swift response from the US Secret Service.

items.title: Jamie Foxx remains hospitalized nearly a week after 'medical complication'
items.content: Jamie Foxx remains hospitalized in Georgia nearly a week after his daughter revealed the actor experienced a "medical complication," a source with knowledge of the matter told CNN on Monday.

items.title: A 13-year-old dies after participating in a Benadryl TikTok 'challenge'
items.content: A 13-year-old in Ohio has died after "he took a bunch of Benadryl," trying a dangerous TikTok challenge that's circulating online, according to a CNN affiliate and a GoFundMe account from his family.

items.title: See pizza delivery guy take out suspect fleeing police
items.content: Pizza guy delivers more than a pie, taking out a fleeing suspect. CNN's Jeanne Moos shows him putting his best foot forward.

items.title: Netflix is winding down its DVD business after 25 years
items.content: Netflix is officially winding down the business that helped make it a household name.

items.title: FTC chair Lina Khan warns AI could 'turbocharge' fraud and scams
items.content: Artificial intelligence tools such as ChatGPT could lead to a "turbocharging" of consumer harms including fraud and scams, and the US government has substantial authority to crack down on AI-driven consumer harms under existing law, members of the Federal Trade Commission said Tuesday.

items.title: Eating too much of these foods is driving the rise in type 2 diabetes, study says
items.content: Gobbling up too many refined wheat and rice products, along with eating too few whole grains, is fueling the growth of new cases of type 2 diabetes worldwide, according to a new study that models data through 2018.

items.title: ADHD medication abuse in schools is a 'wake-up call'
items.content: At some middle and high schools in the United States, 1 in 4 teens report they've abused prescription stimulants for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder during the year prior, a new study found.

items.title: Apple CEO was presented with an original Macintosh. See his reaction
items.content: CEO Tim Cook personally welcomed customers to the new Apple store in Mumbai as the tech company opens its first retail stores in India. CNN's Vedika Sud reports.

items.title: Democrats bash Justice Clarence Thomas but their plan to investigate ethics allegations is unclear
items.content: Senate Democrats railed against Justice Clarence Thomas on Tuesday amid reports that the Supreme Court conservative failed to disclose luxury travel, gifts and a real estate transaction involving a GOP megadonor, but their plan to investigate the conservative jurist remains unclear.

items.title: Russia is 'going backwards' in equipment and deploying post WWII-era tanks, according to Western officials
items.content:
• Jailed Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich denied detention appeal in Moscow
• Putin visits Russian troops at military headquarters in Kherson
• Watch moment WSJ journalist appears in Russian court

items.title: Two Russians claiming to be former Wagner commanders admit killing children and civilians in Ukraine
items.content: Two Russian men who claim to be former Wagner Group commanders have told a human rights activist that they killed children and civilians during their time in Ukraine.

items.title: 'My stomach is hurting from laughing': Hear panelist's reaction to DeSantis' threat to Disney
items.content: CNN panelists react to Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis floating the idea of building a competing theme park next to Disney World in Orlando.

items.title: GOP prepared to block vote to replace Feinstein on Senate Judiciary
items.content: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said on Tuesday that he hopes to replace Democratic Sen. Dianne Feinstein on the Senate Judiciary Committee with Sen. Ben Cardin of Maryland and aims to set up a floor vote on the issue this afternoon, which Republicans are expected to block.

items.title: Oklahoma governor calls on officials to resign over recording of racist and threatening remarks
McCarthy slams Biden in handling of US debt
items.content: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy traveled to Wall Street on Monday to deliver a fresh warning that the House GOP majority will refuse to lift a cap on government borrowing unless Biden agrees to spending cuts that would effectively neutralize his domestic agenda.

items.title: US warns Russia not to touch American nuclear technology at Ukrainian nuclear plant
items.content: The US has sensitive nuclear technology at a nuclear power plant inside Ukraine and is warning Russia not to touch it, according to a letter the US Department of Energy sent to Russia's state-owned nuclear energy firm Rosatom last month.

items.title: Repeated gunshots fired on live TV as ex-lawmaker shot by assassins
items.content: Atiq Ahmed, a former lawmaker in India's parliament, convicted of kidnapping, was shot dead along with his brother while police were escorting them for a medical check-up in a slaying caught on live television on Saturday. CNN's Vedika Sud reports.

items.title: FDA clears the way for additional bivalent boosters for certain vulnerable individuals
items.content: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration amended the terms of its emergency use authorizations for the Pfizer and Moderna bivalent vaccines on Tuesday, allowing people ages 65 and older and certain people with weakened immunity to get additional doses before this fall's vaccination campaigns.

items.title: Maine authorities detained a person of interest after 4 people were found dead in a home and 3 others shot while driving
items.content: Maine authorities have detained a person of interest and continue to investigate after two shooting incidents that appear to be connected left at least four people dead and three others injured, state police said.

items.title: Southwest says flights resumed after delays caused by 'tech issues'
items.content:
• Delta Air Lines reports record bookings for summer travel
• Air France and Airbus acquitted in trial over 2009 plane crash

items.title: Damar Hamlin cleared to resume football activities after January cardiac arrest
items.content: Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin, who has been cleared to resume football activities, said Tuesday his cardiac arrest during an NFL game in January was caused by commotio cordis.

items.title: Pilot makes history after landing on top of a 56-story hotel
items.content: Polish pilot Lukasz Czepiela made history after landing a plane on a helipad at the top of a 56-story hotel in Dubai.

items.title: Top US Navy admiral defends non-binary sailor amid some Republican criticism
items.content: The top US Navy admiral ardently defended a non-binary sailor on Tuesday amid some criticism from Republican lawmakers, saying he is "particularly proud of this sailor."

items.title: Fulton County DA says fake Trump electors are incriminating one another and wants lawyer disqualified
items.content: The Fulton County District Attorney's office said some fake electors for Donald Trump have implicated each other in potential criminal activity and is seeking to disqualify their lawyer, according to a new court filing.

items.title: High speed trains are racing across the world. But not in America
items.content: High speed trains have proved their worth across the world over the past 50 years.

items.title: Podcast: One country musician is calling for other artists to oppose assault rifles
Here's what you need to know if you haven't filed your return yet — and even if you have
items.content: It's April 18, the official deadline to file your federal and state income tax returns for 2022. (It is also, apparently, National Animal Crackers Day for those who celebrate.)

items.title: Undocumented immigrants are paying their taxes today, too
items.content: It's a surprising fact that's often overlooked in the immigration debate.

items.title: Opinion: Why millionaires like us want to pay more in taxes
items.content: Tuesday is Tax Day in America, one of the most stressful days of the year, when many taxpayers will finally end their procrastination, file their federal returns, and hope for a refund from the IRS. But for many of the nation's wealthiest, it's just another Tuesday.

items.title: 'World's longest' purpose-built cycling tunnel opens in Norway
items.content: There are many ways to explore the seven mountains that surround the picturesque UNESCO World Heritage city of Bergen on Norway's fjord-studded west coast. The newest, however, might well be record-breaking.

items.title: Artist rejects photo prize after AI-generated image wins award
items.content: A German artist has rejected an award from a prestigious international photography competition after revealing that his submission was generated by Artificial Intelligence (AI).

items.title: These ships disappeared in Lake Superior a century ago. Watch as they're found again
items.content: The Great Lakes Shipwreck Historical Society has found two of three ships that sank in the same Lake Superior storm more than a century ago, locating one in 2021 and the other in 2022.

items.title: Erotic images of seniors show sex and intimacy in new light
items.content: What does intimacy look like for seniors? There's no end to sex scenes and other steamy content featuring the young and unwrinkled, but past a certain age, popular culture largely draws a blank — or treats sex as a punchline.

items.title: China's economy is off to a solid start, rising 4.5% in Q1 2023
items.content: China's economy is off to a solid start in 2023 following its emergence from three years of strict pandemic restrictions.

items.title: Even when wives make as much as husbands, they still do more at home

items.title: McDonald's is upgrading its burgers
items.content: McDonald's, which has been focusing on upgrading its core items to boost sales, is rolling out a series of changes designed to improve its signature burgers.

items.title: Google-parent stock drops on fears it could lose search market share to AI-powered rivals
items.content: Shares of Google-parent Alphabet fell more than 3% in early trading Monday after a report sparked concerns that its core search engine could lose market share to AI-powered rivals, including Microsoft's Bing.

items.title: The 2024 presidential alternative many voters will want
Why isn't the House Judiciary Committee looking into Thomas?
items.content: On Monday, the GOP-controlled House Judiciary Committee — chaired by Donald Trump ally Rep. Jim Jordan — is set to hold a field hearing in New York City called "Victims of Violent Crime in Manhattan." A statement bills the hearing as an examination of how, the Judiciary Committee says, Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg's policies have "led to an increase in violent crime and a dangerous community for New York City residents."

items.title: Top secrets come spilling out
items.content: In 1917, British analysts deciphered a coded message the German foreign minister sent to one of his country's diplomats vowing to begin "unrestricted submarine warfare" and seeking to win over Mexico with a promise to "reconquer the lost territory in Texas, New Mexico and Arizona" if the US entered the world war. When it became public, the Zimmerman Telegram caused a sensation, helping propel the US into the conflict against Germany.

items.title: How did Sudan go from casting off despotic rule to this?
items.content: Four years ago, almost to the day, the people of Sudan were celebrating a revolution after overthrowing longtime dictator Omar al-Bashir. Now the East African country faces the possibility of a complete collapse similar to the chaos we see today in Yemen or Libya.

items.title: Michelle Yeoh set to return in new 'Star Trek' movie
items.content: Live long and prosper, Michelle Yeoh.

items.title: Recap: 'Succession' finds dark humor in the aftershocks
items.content: After the shock came the aftershocks, the power vacuum, and perhaps most significantly and impressively, the laughs, as "Succession" pivoted to face life after Logan Roy, in an episode that finally put the HBO show's title into full flower.

items.title: 'Yellowjackets' leans hard into '90s music nostalgia, and we're here for it
items.content: Of the many dark gifts Showtime's eerie hit series "Yellowjackets" serves up for us, the juiciest this season is by far the music.

items.title: Jeremy Renner revisits 'the amazing group of people' who helped him recover from his accident
items.content: Jeremy Renner is continuing his recovery after his devastating snowplow accident in January, and recognizing those who've helped him along the way.

items.title: Review: 'Barry' takes a whack at its farewell season
items.content: "Barry" has taken chances from the very beginning, which is certainly true of a fourth and final season that picks up where the third left off, with its hitman-turned-wannabe actor getting arrested. That paves the way for an even darker season that accentuates the show's ensemble aspect while leaning a little too heavily on blurring lines with flights of fancy.

items.title: Brex, once a Silicon Valley darling, is laying off 20% of its workforce
items.content:
Brex, a US fintech startup, has cut more than 200 employees from its 1,000-person workforce. This move shows that even a decacorn—a privately held company with a valuation topping $10 billion—isn’t immune to job losses. The startup said it’s doing some restructuring, according to an email sent today (Jan. 23) to an…

items.content:
Once upon a time, the main proposition of streaming services like Netflix was that you could watch what you wanted, when you wanted. But as the services have increasingly started bailing on creating original content that users could pick up from libraries, they’ve been investing more in live events such as sports.…

items.title: China is importing fewer chips and more chipmaking machines
items.content:
In a clear sign of Beijing’s efforts to speed up the development of its homegrown semiconductor industry amid Washington’s intensifying technology restrictions, China’s imports of chipmaking machines hit a near-record last year—while its chip imports saw their steepest decline on record.

Intermediate goods are inputs used to produce a final product. Think textiles to make a coat, metals to make a car, and computer chips to make an iPhone.

items.title: Millions live near US railways shipping the toxic chemical that contaminated East Palestine, Ohio
items.content:
The toxic, flammable gas that notoriously spilled into the town of East Palestine, Ohio, last year still rides on rail lines through eight major US cities. In fact, as much as 36 million pounds of the chemical, vinyl chloride, are carried on trains through the country at any given time, according to a new study by…

items.title: It's expensive to replace humans with AI, MIT says
items.content:
Fears of robots taking over people’s jobs have been a recurring theme for centuries, and with recent advancements in AI, the anxiety has resurfaced. But fear not, humans! A new study from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) offers a reassuring perspective: most jobs are currently too expensive to automate…

It makes sense, then, that a pair of activist investor groups would suggest that ExxonMobil Corp., the world’s largest privately owned oil company,…

items.title: Apple's Vision Pro headsets are "still very niche" despite a sellout in pre-ordering, expert says
items.content:
Apple sold between 160,000 and 180,000 Visio Pro headsets over the weekend during pre-orders, according to analyst Ming-Chi Kuo of TF International Securities, who’s written extensively about the product on Medium. But the mixed-reality device won’t be super popular with the general public anytime soon, he indicated.

items.title: Baby boomers are hoarding houses and leaving a laundry list of big fixes for younger buyers
items.content:
The housing market is tough today for young Americans. Prices are high. Interest rates are high. The savings needed for a deposit are getting eaten up by inflation, job loss, and childcare. Unfortunately, tomorrow’s housing market isn’t shaping up to be too great, either.

items.title: An app company in Kazakhstan just had the biggest IPO since Birkenstock
items.content:
Kaspi.kz, a mobile app company, launched its initial public offering (IPO) on the Nasdaq stock exchange Friday, raising about $1 billion. On its first trading day, shares of Kaspi.kz debuted 0.5% above its offer price, valuing the company at $17.51 billion.

items.title: 1 sentence got Spirit Airlines stock back in the air
items.content:
The low-price carrier Spirit Airlines is in trouble after a federal judge blocked its merger with JetBlue Airlines for antitrust reasons. It’s not profitable. Its onetime prospective corporate sibling is leaving it hanging out to dry on the question of appealing the merger blockage.

items.title: Drug makers just hiked prices for Ozempic and a lot of other drugs
items.content:

items.title: Ford is slashing Lightning production in half because people don't actually want EV trucks yet
items.content:

items.title: Fox News Politics: Five takeaways from the New Hampshire primary
items.content: The latest updates from the 2024 campaign trail, exclusive interviews and more Fox News politics content

items.title: Lara Trump predicts US won't be 'the same country' if GOP voters don't rally behind Trump to defeat Biden
items.content: Lara Trump told Fox News Digital that Biden is handing the GOP the election on a "silver platter" and she believes the party will unite behind her father-in-law.

items.title: Biden's Pentagon nominee grilled on selling of border wall parts, Chinese spy balloon: 'Caught flat-footed'
items.content: Melissa Dalton, President Biden's nominee for Air Force Undersecretary, was grilled on the border and the Chinese spy balloon before the Senate Armed Services Committee.

items.title: 4th graders in New Hampshire designed 'I Voted' stickers for the primary elections
items.content: For the first time, a contest was held in New Hampshire where students submitted designs for the stickers given out at the polls. Three different designs were chosen and distributed.

items.title: First lady Jill Biden invites Texas woman who sought illegal abortion to State of the Union address
items.content: First Lady Jill Biden has invited Kate Cox, a Texas mother who unsuccessfully challenged her state's abortion ban, to be her guest at the State of the Union address in March.

items.title: Hawley raises alarm after border gotaways exceed Kansas City, St Louis populations combined last fiscal year
items.content: Sen. Josh Hawley, R-Mo., is asking DHS Secretary Mayorkas for confirmation of staggering new numbers of gotaways estimated in a CBO report recently published.

items.title: GOP Sens Fischer and Cornyn endorse Trump after New Hampshire victory: 'Trump is Republican voters' choice'
items.content: GOP Sens. John Cornyn and Deb Fischer endorse former President Trump after his New Hampshire primary win, urging party unity to defeat President Biden and address the border, economy and national security.

items.title: Biden's new campaign chair previously called Republicans a 'bunch of f---ers'
items.content: Top Biden aide Jennifer O'Malley Dillon, who is transitioning from the White House to Biden's campaign, previously called Republicans a 'bunch of fu--ers.'

items.title: Hawaii Democrat introduces bill to ban Trump from ballot
items.content: The Hawaii legislature advanced a bill that aims to ban presidential candidates over 14th Amendment's insurrection clause, implicating former President Trump.

items.title: Congress keeps going like a broken record on spending, border, shutdown fights
items.content: Congress has repeated fights over spending, the border and Ukraine aid for months, sounding a bit like a broken record.

items.title: RNC Chair McDaniel tells Fox News 'we need to unite' around Trump
items.content: Republican National Committee Chairwoman Ronna McDaniel compliments Nikki Haley but tells Fox News it's time for the GOP to unite around former President Trump in order to take on President Biden.

items.title: House Republicans unveil effort to block Biden admin from tearing down key hydro dams
items.content: FIRST ON FOX: A group of House Republicans representing the Pacific Northwest are hitting back after the Biden administration announced a legal settlement with eco groups.

items.title: GOP lawmakers urge DOJ to forgo immigration lawsuit against Lone Star State: 'Texas should not be punished'
items.content: Texas GOP lawmakers are calling on the DOJ to forgo its lawsuit against the Lone Star State, claiming the state "should not be punished" for the Biden administation's failures.

items.title: Tennessee law regarding HIV-positive sex workers could soon be revised
items.content: TN's law that requires HIV-positive convicted sex workers to be registered as violent sex offenders for life is being challenged in federal court as discriminatory.

items.title: Open-air drug use, overdoses push Democrats to introduce overhaul of first-in-the-nation decriminalization law
items.content: As Oregon reckons with rampant drug use, Democrats unveiled a plan to undo a key portion of the state's pioneering drug decriminalization law passed by voters in 2020.

items.title: Delaware House passes 'human composting' bill with broad support
items.content: The DE House passed a measure to allow “natural organic reduction," also known as "human composting," which turns human remains into soil, on a 37-2 vote.

items.title: Haley allies admit she has 'steeper road ahead' facing Trump in South Carolina
items.content: Americans for Prosperity Action says former South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley faces an "uphill battle" and a "steeper road ahead" against former President Trump before the South Carolina primaries.

items.title: Trump, Biden agree on one thing about the Republican primary
items.content: President Biden said "it is now clear that Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee" after Trump's convincing wins in the Iowa caucuses and New Hampshire primary election.

items.title: House GOP threatens Harvard with 'compulsory measures' after 'inadequate' response to antisemitism probe
items.content: House Republicans are threatening to take action against Harvard University after the Ivy League gave what they called "unacceptable" answers to the GOP's antisemitism investigation.

items.title: Sen Vance memo warns GOP colleagues of ‘systemic failures’ in US aid to Ukraine
items.content: Sen. JD Vance is circulating a memo Wednesday morning warning GOP colleagues about a DOD report on flaws in monitoring U.S. aid to Ukraine.

items.title: American University hit with federal complaint over 'persistent' antisemitism
items.content: American University in Washington, D.C., has joined the growing list of universities under investigation by the Department of Education for antisemitism complaints.

items.title: Donald Trump wins New Hampshire primary after record GOP voter turnout
items.content: The 2024 Republican primary is in full swing, as former President Donald Trump continues to hold a commanding lead over former South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley.

feed_description: Analysis, background reports and updates from the PBS NewsHour putting today's news in context.

items.title: Xi Jinping celebrates China’s rising power — and his own
items.content: President Xi Jinping opened China’s twice-per decade Communist Party Congress on Wednesday hailing the reforms he put in place during his first five-year term and sharing his vision for where he hopes to take the nation. William Brangham reports on the congress as it prepares to announce Xi’s successor and how new leadership may transform China’s role as a global economic partner.

items.title: The battle for Mosul is over, but this hidden ISIS danger could lurk for years
items.content: Iraq may have ousted Islamic States militants from the city of Mosul over the summer, but the major task of finding and destroying the mines, booby traps and bombs remains. A security firm hired by the U.S. and Iraqi workers are making progress to clear major areas, but it could take years or even decades. Special correspondent Marcia Biggs reports on the safety of Mosul after ISIS.

items.title: As Rohingya refugees continue to flee from persecution, here’s how you can help
items.content: More than 500,000 Rohingya Muslims have fled their homes since August to escape systematic violence at the hands of government soldiers in Myanmar. Here's how you can help.

items.title: Tillerson: ‘Heartbreaking’ reports of suffering in Myanmar
items.content: WASHINGTON — Secretary of State Rex Tillerson is condemning reported atrocities committed against Rohingya Muslims in Myanmar, and he says those responsible — perhaps the country's military — will be held accountable.

items.title: Far-right groups gain ground in Sweden and Germany amid migrant influx
items.content: Sunday’s election in Austria brought victory to 31-year-old Sebastian Kurz, who was elected chancellor on an anti-immigrant platform. Earlier, a strengthened far-right party dealt a blow to returning leader Angela Merkel in Germany’s election. As Sweden’s election approaches next year, special correspondent Michael Brabant surveys the changing political landscape in Europe.

items.title: U.S.-backed Syrian forces recapture Raqqa from Islamic State group
items.content: U.S.-backed Syrian Democratic Forces announced Tuesday that they had captured the city of Raqqa from Islamic State militants.

items.title: WATCH: Trump and Greek prime minister hold joint news conference
items.content: President Donald Trump says the U.S. stands with Greece as they recover from their economic crisis.

items.title: U.S., Japan agree to maximize diplomatic pressure on North Korea
items.content: TOKYO — U.S. and Japanese diplomats agreed Tuesday to maximize pressure on North Korea to resolve tensions over its nuclear program, while citing the need to be prepared for the worst if diplomacy fails.

items.title: News Wrap: Dozens missing after deadly Mogadishu truck bombing
items.content: In our news wrap Monday, more than 300 people are confirmed dead and nearly 400 wounded after Saturday’s massive truck bombing in Somalia’s capital Mogadishu. The government blamed the al-Qaida-linked group al-Shabab. Also, 31-year-old conservative Sebastian Kurz is set to become the Austria’s next leader in another shift to the right in European politics.

items.title: Why a power struggle has broken out over Kirkuk
items.content: Two vital American allies have reignited their rivalry in Iraq. After months of simmering tensions, national military forces and militia moved to push Kurdish forces out of the disputed city of Kirkuk. Three weeks ago, the Kurds held a referendum to split from Iraq. Lisa Desjardins reports and Judy Woodruff talks with Emma Sky of Yale University and Feisal Istrabadi of Indiana University.

items.title: Rex Tillerson says continue diplomacy with North Korea ‘until first bomb drops’
items.content: That statement comes despite President Donald Trump's tweets a couple of weeks ago that his chief envoy was "wasting his time" trying to negotiate with "Little Rocket Man," a mocking nickname Trump has given the nuclear-armed nation's leader, Kim Jong Un.

items.title: Iraqi, Kurdish forces in standoff, weeks after Kurdish vote for independence
items.content: Iraqi army and Kurdish troops are in a standoff in Kirkuk, a city located in the Kurdistan region, which voted for independence from Iraq last month. Kirkuk holds 10 percent of Iraq’s oil reserves. Washington Post reporter Loveday Morris, who is covering the standoff, joins Hari Sreenivasan via Skype from Baghdad.

items.title: South Sudan civil war causes Africa’s worst refugee crisis
items.content: South Sudan’s four-year civil war has left half of the nation’s population, 6 million people, in need of humanitarian aid and caused one of the world’s worst refugee crises. With support from the U.S. Holocaust Memorial Museum’s Center for the Prevention of Genocide, NewsHour Weekend Special Correspondent Simona Foltyn and journalist Jason Patinkin traveled to Uganda to meet people desperate for asylum.

items.title: Hundreds dead after massive truck bomb strikes Mogadishu
items.content: At least 231 people were killed and hundreds more wounded after a massive truck bomb on Saturday struck Somalia's capital city of Mogadishu.

items.title: Column: Why reporting from South Sudan is so difficult — and critically needed
items.content: The war has had a devastating impact on South Sudanese communities, but much of it has remained out of the limelight of international media.

items.title: Adani Ports: The Tamil Nadu villagers taking on a billionaire's port plan
items.content: Locals in 100 villages of Tamil Nadu state are fighting the expansion of a port owned by Gautam Adani.

items.title: Umar Khalid: Indian activist languishes in jail without bail or trial
items.content: Umar Khalid, who was arrested three years ago for alleged involvement in riots, is still waiting for a trial.

items.title: Shoaib Bashir: England spinner granted visa to travel to India
items.content: England spinner Shoaib Bashir is granted a visa to travel to India and could be back with the Test squad by the weekend.

items.title: Australian Open 2024 results: Rohan Bopanna becomes oldest tennis world number one aged 43
items.content: Rohan Bopanna becomes the oldest tennis world number one aged 43 after he and Matthew Ebden reach the Australian Open doubles semi-finals.

items.title: Watch: Crowds at India's new Ram temple in Ayodhya day after opening
items.content: The grand temple dedicated to the Hindu God Ram was inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday.

items.title: Ayodhya Ram Mandir: India PM Modi inaugurates Hindu temple on razed Babri mosque site
items.content: The rituals were led by PM Narendra Modi, while opposition leaders and some Hindu seers stayed away.

items.title: Sony calls off merger with India media giant Zee
items.content: Zee considers legal action after Sony ends the planned $10bn merger of the firms' Indian operations.

items.title: Watch: Indian PM Modi inaugurates temple in Ayodhya
items.content: The opening of the grand temple comes ahead of India's general elections.

items.title: India v Afghanistan: Two super overs as Rohit Sharma hits record century in T20 series win
items.content: Captain Rohit Sharma hits a record fifth T20 international century as India secure a 3-0 series win over Afghanistan after two super overs.

items.title: Man locked in SpiceJet plane toilet for over an hour
items.content: The passenger got stuck inside the lavatory of a SpiceJet flight after the door malfunctioned mid-journey.

items.title: Flight cancellations: Airport chaos angers Indians as fog hits travel
items.content: A man was arrested for slapping a pilot, while others were seen eating food on the Mumbai airport tarmac.

items.title: Ayodhya: Temple to open at India’s religious fault-line
items.content: The new temple in Ayodhya has stirred up memories for the community caught up in 1992's violence.

items.title: Kashmir's rare snowless winter sets off alarm bells
items.content: Experts say that the absence of snowfall this winter will lead to water scarcity and derail the economy.

items.title: Lakshadweep: Can India's 'alternative Maldives' handle mass tourism?
items.content: Indian PM Modi's recent visit to Lakshadweep could spark a tourist surge - but is the island chain ready?

items.title: Gujarat boat capsize victims 'not given life jackets'
items.content: Parents of students who died after a boat capsized in India's Gujarat state allege negligence by authorities.

items.title: What Rahul Gandhi's march means for India election
items.content: The Congress leader's cross-country march began with hope, but analysts doubt its electoral impact.

items.title: Agatha Christie: The Indian hotel murder that inspired the queen of crime
items.content: The sensational case, which made global headlines, is said to have influenced Christie's first book.

items.title: Bengaluru: Why English is dividing people in India's Silicon Valley
items.content: Kannada-language protesters recently hit the headlines for tearing down English billboards in Bengaluru.

items.title: Bihar men conned by 'impregnating women' job scam
items.content: Scammers in Bihar state promised to pay huge sums of money to men to get childless women pregnant.

items.title: Maldives: Maldivians debate India's 'boycott' of their nation
items.content: Tensions have escalated after three Maldivian ministers made derogatory comments about India's PM Modi.

items.title: Ex-Air India scrap plane gets stuck under bridge in Bihar
items.content: The scrap fuselage was on its way to Assam from Mumbai on a lorry when it got stuck.

items.title: Watch: Intruder jumps on table in Indian parliament
items.content: Lawmakers said two men jumped into the well of the house from the visitors' gallery.

items.title: Uttarakhand tunnel collapse: Moment Indian workers freed after weeks
items.content: Fourty-one Indian workers are finally rescued from a tunnel that partially caved in after a landslide.

items.title: Watch: First video of trapped tunnel workers in India’s Uttarakhand
items.content: Rescuers have shared a video of the 41 workers who have been trapped inside a tunnel since 12 November.

items.title: Andhra Pradesh: Drone footage shows aftermath of deadly India train crash
items.content: A preliminary investigation has found that "human error" led to the collision, officials say.

items.title: India flash floods: More than 100 missing in Sikkim state
items.content: Hundreds of search and rescue officers have been deployed across the state of Sikkim.
